intro: Brownea chocoana, commonly known as the Chocó brownea, is a striking tropical plant native to the rainforests of Colombia and Ecuador. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers. The plant produces large, trumpet-shaped blooms in shades of red, orange, and yellow, often with a prominent yellow throat. Its foliage consists of glossy, dark green, elliptical leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. Brownea chocoana thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense rainforest canopies.
